title: Smartbroker Holding AG (ETR:SB1) Is Expected To Breakeven In The Near Future
description: Smartbroker Holding AG ( ETR:SB1 ) is possibly approaching a major achievement in its business, so we would like to...
content:
Smartbroker Holding AG (ETR:SB1) is possibly approaching a major achievement in its business, so we would like to shine some light on the company. Smartbroker Holding AG operates as online broker in Germany. On 31 December 2024, the €208m market-cap company posted a loss of €1.4m for its most recent financial year. Many investors are wondering about the rate at which Smartbroker Holding will turn a profit, with the big question being “when will the company breakeven?” In this article, we will touch on the expectations for the company's growth and when analysts expect it to become profitable.

We've found 21 US stocks that are forecast to pay a dividend yield of over 6% next year. See the full list for free.

Consensus from 2 of the German Interactive Media and Services analysts is that Smartbroker Holding is on the verge of breakeven. They expect the company to post a final loss in 2026, before turning a profit of €100k in 2027. Therefore, the company is expected to breakeven roughly 2 years from now. In order to meet this breakeven date, we calculated the rate at which the company must grow year-on-year. It turns out an average annual growth rate of 0.7% is expected, which is relatively conservative. If this rate turns out to be too low, the company may become profitable faster than analysts expect.

We're not going to go through company-specific developments for Smartbroker Holding given that this is a high-level summary, though, keep in mind that by and large periods of lower growth in the upcoming years is not out of the ordinary, particularly when a company is in a period of investment.

See our latest analysis for Smartbroker Holding

One thing we’d like to point out is that The company has managed its capital prudently, with debt making up 13% of equity. This means that it has predominantly funded its operations from equity capital, and its low debt obligation reduces the risk around investing in the loss-making company.

There are too many aspects of Smartbroker Holding to cover in one brief article, but the key fundamentals for the company can all be found in one place – Smartbroker Holding's company page on Simply Wall St. We've also put together a list of essential factors you should look at:
• Valuation: What is Smartbroker Holding worth today? Has the future growth potential already been factored into the price? The intrinsic value infographic in our free research report helps visualize whether Smartbroker Holding is currently mispriced by the market.
• Management Team: An experienced management team on the helm increases our confidence in the business – take a look at who sits on Smartbroker Holding’s board and the CEO’s background.
• Other High-Performing Stocks: Are there other stocks that provide better prospects with proven track records? Explore our free list of these great stocks here.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.



This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: Smartbroker Holding AG (ETR:SB1) is expected to breakven on 31 December 2024, with a €208m market-cap company posting a loss of €1.4m for its most recent financial year. The company's growth rate is estimated at 0.7%, a relatively conservative rate, which could lead to a faster profit than expected if this rate turns out to be too low, potentially leading to faster growth than expected. The firm is also expected to post a final loss in 2026, before turning a profit of €100k in 2027. The key fundamentals for Smartbroker holding include an experienced management team and a low debt obligation.
shortSummary: Smartbroker Holding AG is expected to breakeven within 2 years, driven by strong growth and prudent management, but may also undervalue its current value.

argos_summary: Smartbroker Holding AG, a German online broker with a €208m market cap, posted a €1.4m loss in 2024 but is projected to break even in 2027 with an average annual growth rate of 0.7%. Analysts see a modest path to profitability, citing low debt (13% of equity) and a fair value estimate of €23.43 versus the current €12.40 price. The company’s valuation is considered significantly undervalued, with a price‑to‑sales ratio of 4x against an industry average of 1.6x. The outlook is based on Simply Wall St analysis and analyst consensus forecasts.
